content:
I’m a final-year PhD student at the Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC) in Barcelona and a memeber of the Language and Speech Technologies and Applications (TALP) research group.
My research focuses on approaches to neural machine translation (NMT) that leverage unsupervised and continual learning methods. I’m advised by Dr. Marta Ruiz Costa-jussà.
I’m a co-organizer of the Lifelong Learning for Machine Translation shared task and the Similar Language Translation shared task at the Fifth Conference on Machine Translation (WMT20) held in conjunction with EMNLP 2020.

title: Magdalena Biesialska
Continual Lifelong Learning in Natural Language Processing: A Survey

summary: Nominated for Best Paper Award (top 6.97% of accepted regular papers).
title: Sentiment Analysis with Contextual Embeddings and Self-Attention
Refinement of Unsupervised Cross-Lingual Word Embeddings
Enhancing Word Embeddings with Knowledge Extracted from Lexical Resources

summary: Ranked 1st for Czech→Polish and 2nd for Spanish→Portuguese translation systems.
title: The TALP-UPC System for the WMT Similar Language Task: Statistical vs Neural Machine Translation
